CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 8, 1960, pg. 1, reads: "Pittsburgh Favorites - Billy Eckstine, local native son who sang the national anthem during pre-game ceremonies, and Dick Stuart, the Pirates long-ball-hitting first basemen and an 'adopted local son,' greet each other before the Bucs took the Yanks into camp, 6-4.  Billy recalled he was a little boy when his late father took him to see the Yanks crush the Pirates in four straight games in 1927. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Billy Eckstine shaking hands with Pittsburgh Pirates baseball player Dick Stuart, at opening game of 1960 World Series, Forbes Field
